medical_history.chief_complaint: Left hemiparesis suggesting a right hemisphere stroke.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: One month after being diagnosed with endometrial carcinoma, the patient presented with left hemiparesis. MRI confirmed a frontal infarction in the anterior cerebral artery territory, indicating a right hemisphere stroke.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Endometrial carcinoma, peritoneal metastases, and nodal metastases.
medical_history.social_history: Risk factors such as smoking, hypertension, and hypercholesterolemia were found on the patientâ€™s medical records.
